intro: Nicotiana colossea, commonly known as the nightshade or blueflower tobacco, is a herbaceous plant native to the southern United States and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive grayish-green color. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Botanically, it is part of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers.
